Comment: This command info is generated from fig
Name: docker-compose
Description: Define and run multi-container applications with Docker

Arguments.Name: --ansi
Arguments.Description: Control when to print ANSI control characters ("never"|"always"|"auto")

Arguments.Name: --compatibility
Arguments.Description: Run compose in backward compatibility mode

Arguments.Name: --no-ansi
Arguments.Description: Do not print ANSI control characters (DEPRECATED)

Arguments.Name: --project-directory
Arguments.Description: Specify an alternate working directory (default: the path of the, first specified, Compose file)

Arguments.Name: --workdir
Arguments.Description: DEPRECATED! USE --project-directory INSTEAD. Specify an alternate working directory (default: the path of the, first specified, Compose file)

Arguments.Name: --compress
Arguments.Description: Compress the build context using gzip. DEPRECATED

Arguments.Name: --memory
Arguments.Description: Set memory limit for the build container. Not supported on buildkit yet

Arguments.Name: --no-cache
Arguments.Description: Do not use cache when building the image

Arguments.Name: --no-rm
Arguments.Description: Do not remove intermediate containers after a successful build. DEPRECATED

Arguments.Name: --progress
Arguments.Description: Set type of progress output (auto, tty, plain, quiet)

Arguments.Name: --pull
Arguments.Description: Always attempt to pull a newer version of the image

Arguments.Name: --ssh
Arguments.Description: Set SSH authentications used when building service images. (use 'default' for using your default SSH Agent)

Arguments.Name: config
Arguments.Description: Converts the compose file to platform's canonical format

Arguments.Name: --hash
Arguments.Description: Print the service config hash, one per line

Arguments.Name: --images
Arguments.Description: Print the image names, one per line

Arguments.Name: --profiles
Arguments.Description: Print the profile names, one per line

Arguments.Name: --quiet
Arguments.Description: Only validate the configuration, don't print anything

Arguments.Name: --services
Arguments.Description: Print the service names, one per line

Arguments.Name: --volumes
Arguments.Description: Print the volume names, one per line

Arguments.Name: cp
Arguments.Description: Copy files/folders between a service container and the local filesystem

Arguments.Name: --all
Arguments.Description: Copy to all the containers of the service

Arguments.Name: --follow-link
Arguments.Description: Always follow symbol link in SRC_PATH

Arguments.Name: --index
Arguments.Description: Index of the container if there are multiple instances of a service

Arguments.Name: --force-recreate
Arguments.Description: Recreate containers even if their configuration and image haven't changed

Arguments.Name: --no-build
Arguments.Description: Don't build an image, even if it's missing

Arguments.Name: --no-recreate
Arguments.Description: If containers already exist, don't recreate them. Incompatible with --force-recreate

Arguments.Name: --remove-orphans
Arguments.Description: Remove containers for services not defined in the Compose file

Arguments.Name: --rmi
Arguments.Description: Remove images used by services. "local" remove only images that don't have a custom tag ("local"|"all")

Arguments.Name: --timeout
Arguments.Description: Specify a shutdown timeout in seconds

Arguments.Name: --volumes
Arguments.Description: Remove named volumes declared in the `volumes` section of the Compose file and anonymous volumes attached to containers

Arguments.Name: events
Arguments.Description: Receive real time events from containers

Arguments.Name: --json
Arguments.Description: Output events as a stream of json objects

Arguments.Name: exec
Arguments.Description: Execute a command in a running container

Arguments.Name: --detach
Arguments.Description: Detached mode: Run command in the background

Arguments.Name: --index
Arguments.Description: Index of the container if there are multiple instances of a service [default: 1]

Arguments.Name: --interactive
Arguments.Description: Keep STDIN open even if not attached

Arguments.Name: --no-TTY
Arguments.Description: Disable pseudo-TTY allocation. By default `docker compose exec` allocates a TTY

Arguments.Name: --privileged
Arguments.Description: Give extended privileges to the process

Arguments.Name: --user
Arguments.Description: Run the command as this user

Arguments.Name: --workdir
Arguments.Description: Path to workdir directory for this command

Arguments.Name: images
Arguments.Description: List images used by the created containers

Arguments.Name: --signal
Arguments.Description: SIGNAL to send to the container

Arguments.Name: --since
Arguments.Description: Show logs since timestamp (e.g. 2013-01-02T13:23:37Z) or relative (e.g. 42m for 42 minutes)

Arguments.Name: --tail
Arguments.Description: Number of lines to show from the end of the logs for each container

Arguments.Name: --until
Arguments.Description: Show logs before a timestamp (e.g. 2013-01-02T13:23:37Z) or relative (e.g. 42m for 42 minutes)

Arguments.Name: --filter
Arguments.Description: Filter output based on conditions provided

Arguments.Name: port
Arguments.Description: Print the public port for a port binding

Arguments.Name: --index
Arguments.Description: Index of the container if service has multiple replicas

Arguments.Name: --all
Arguments.Description: Show all stopped containers (including those created by the run command)

Arguments.Name: --filter
Arguments.Description: Filter services by a property (supported filters: status)

Arguments.Name: --status
Arguments.Description: Filter services by status. Values: [paused | restarting | removing | running | dead | created | exited]

Arguments.Name: --ignore-pull-failures
Arguments.Description: Pull what it can and ignores images with pull failures

Arguments.Name: --include-deps
Arguments.Description: Also pull services declared as dependencies

Arguments.Name: --parallel
Arguments.Description: DEPRECATED pull multiple images in parallel

Arguments.Name: --ignore-push-failures
Arguments.Description: Push what it can and ignores images with push failures

Arguments.Name: --timeout
Arguments.Description: Specify a shutdown timeout in seconds

Arguments.Name: --stop
Arguments.Description: Stop the containers, if required, before removing

Arguments.Name: --volumes
Arguments.Description: Remove any anonymous volumes attached to containers

Arguments.Name: run
Arguments.Description: Run a one-off command on a service

Arguments.Name: --detach
Arguments.Description: Run container in background and print container ID

Arguments.Name: --entrypoint
Arguments.Description: Override the entrypoint of the image

Arguments.Name: --interactive
Arguments.Description: Keep STDIN open even if not attached

Arguments.Name: --name
Arguments.Description: Assign a name to the container

Arguments.Name: --publish
Arguments.Description: Publish a container's port(s) to the host

Arguments.Name: --rm
Arguments.Description: Automatically remove the container when it exits

Arguments.Name: --service-ports
Arguments.Description: Run command with the service's ports enabled and mapped to the host

Arguments.Name: --use-aliases
Arguments.Description: Use the service's network useAliases in the network(s) the container connects to

Arguments.Name: --user
Arguments.Description: Run as specified username or uid

Arguments.Name: --timeout
Arguments.Description: Specify a shutdown timeout in seconds

Arguments.Name: --abort-on-container-exit
Arguments.Description: Stops all containers if any container was stopped. Incompatible with -d

Arguments.Name: --detach
Arguments.Description: Detached mode: Run containers in the background

Arguments.Name: --exit-code-from
Arguments.Description: Return the exit code of the selected service container. Implies --abort-on-container-exit

Arguments.Name: --force-recreate
Arguments.Description: Recreate containers even if their configuration and image haven't changed

Arguments.Name: --no-build
Arguments.Description: Don't build an image, even if it's missing

Arguments.Name: --no-recreate
Arguments.Description: If containers already exist, don't recreate them. Incompatible with --force-recreate

Arguments.Name: --no-start
Arguments.Description: Don't start the services after creating them

Arguments.Name: --remove-orphans
Arguments.Description: Remove containers for services not defined in the Compose file

Arguments.Name: --renew-anon-volumes
Arguments.Description: Recreate anonymous volumes instead of retrieving data from the previous containers

Arguments.Name: --scale
Arguments.Description: Scale SERVICE to NUM instances. Overrides the `scale` setting in the Compose file if present

Arguments.Name: --timeout
Arguments.Description: Use this timeout in seconds for container shutdown when attached or when containers are already running

Arguments.Name: --wait
Arguments.Description: Wait for services to be running|healthy. Implies detached mode

Arguments.Name: version
Arguments.Description: Show the Docker Compose version information

Arguments.Name: --format
Arguments.Description: Format the output. Values: [pretty | json]. (Default: pretty)
